byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

abstract: War between Turkish government and Kurds in country's southeast has reignited since Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan resumed battle with Kurdistan Workers' Party; Turkey has executed at least 400 airstrikes in Turkey and in northern Iraq against PKK bases.
lead_paragraph: A war that had long been stilled by a truce is now threatening to undo an economic turnaround and adding a battlefield to a region already consumed by chaos.

headline.main: As Turkey Targets Militants, War Grips Kurdish Lands Once Again
headline.print_headline: As Turkey Focuses on Militants, Kurdish Areas Again Become Battlegrounds

snippet: A war that had long been stilled by a truce is now threatening to undo an economic turnaround and adding a battlefield to a region already consumed by chaos.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
